subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Wednesday, 27 June, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Liverpool step up move for Torres
Liverpool are locked in talks with Atletico Madrid to sign £27m-rated striker Fernando Torres, BBC Sport understands.



 
Chelsea silent on Grant rumours
Chelsea refuse to comment on speculation that Portsmouth technical director Avram Grant is to join them.



 
Newcastle close in on Geremi deal
Newcastle are understood to be poised to signing Chelsea's Geremi on a free transfer.








GOLF




Monty hires caddie 'permanently'
Colin Montgomerie takes on Paul Casey's former caddie Craig Connelly on a long-term basis and not just for the French Open.



 
Illness hampers Van de Velde bid
Jean van de Velde is battling a mystery illness which is threatening to undermine his chances of qualifying for next month's Open.



 
Big names feud ahead of US Open
Michelle Wie is refusing to apologise to Annika Sorenstam after controversially pulling out of an event the Swede was hosting.








MOTORSPORT




Dennis should enjoy battle - Hill
Damon Hill says McLaren boss Ron Dennis to sit back and enjoy Lewis
Hamilton and Fernando Alonso's world championship tussle.



 
Stoner scorches to Donington win
Championship leader Casey Stoner produces another dominant display to win the British MotoGP.



 
Ferrari mechanic denies sabotage
Ferrari technical manager Nigel Stepney denies allegations of sabotage made against him by the F1 team.








FORMULA ONE




Dennis should enjoy battle - Hill
Damon Hill says McLaren boss Ron Dennis to sit back and enjoy Lewis
Hamilton and Fernando Alonso's world championship tussle.



 
Ferrari mechanic denies sabotage
Ferrari technical manager Nigel Stepney denies allegations of sabotage made against him by the F1 team.



 
Ferrari wait for 'real Raikkonen'
Ferrari president Luca di Montezemolo says they are still waiting for Kimi Raikkonen to produce his best form.








ATHLETICS




Pickering to lead GB at Euro U23s
In-form sprinter Craig Pickering will compete for Britain at the European Under-23 Championships next month.



 
Gay to take on Don Valley clock
This season's fastest man, Tyson Gay, is lined up for the Norwich Union Grand Prix in Sheffield.



 
Injury may ruin Powell's $1m bid
Asafa Powell could miss the Golden League meeting in Paris after suffering a groin injury in the 100m at the Jamaican championships.








CYCLING




Kessler suspended by Team Astana
German rider Matthias Kessler is suspended by his team after testing positive for excessive levels of testosterone.



 
Petacchi protests his innocence
Alessandro Petacchi denies doing "anything illegal" after returning a "non-negative" test for salbutamol at this year's Giro.



 
Weather forces race postponement
The British Road Race Championships, due to be held in Yorkshire, are called off because of the weather.








FUN AND GAMES




Quotes of the Week
Thierry Henry is gunning for Barcelona, plus Jose Mourinho gets fruity



 
Colin Montgomerie talks to Chris Evans
Colin Montgomerie tells Chris Evans about his quest for a major win at Carnoustie and the search for a new caddie. Evans and sidekick Jonny Saunders have a different sporting guest on their Radio 2 show every evening.



 
Teesside tennis
Robbo wonders what would happen if Wimbledon came to the north east
